p: This is a plant family mainly composed of trees, shrubs, and subshrubs with soft and usually brittle wood. This monogeneric ( Moringa) group contains 13 species primarily distributed in the Horn of Africa but also on the southern coast of the Arabian Peninsula, India, Madagascar, Angola, and Namibia. Even though all the species have local economic uses, M. oleifera is the species with major interest due to its widespread use in folk medicine and as a leaf vegetable crop.
